intro: Senecio gesneriifolius, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. The flowers are often violet or blue in color, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of indoor environments.
